title: Calories in Tilapia Fillet
meta_description: Discover calories in tilapia fillet, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Cooked (baked or grilled) tilapia fillet, skinless, approximately 100g, no added oil, butter, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fish size, source (wild vs. farmed), cooking method, and additions like marinades or oils. Check product labels or reliable databases for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One 100g cooked tilapia fillet provides about 128 kcal and 26g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pan-fried with 1 tsp oil per fillet
Baked with lemon and herbs (no added fat)

faqs.q: How many calories in one tilapia fillet?
faqs.a: Approximately 128 kcal for a 100g cooked fillet.

faqs.q: Is tilapia fillet high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, one 100g fillet has about 26g of protein.

faqs.q: Does tilapia have carbs or fat?
faqs.a: Negligible carbs (0g) and low fat (2.7g) per 100g cooked fillet.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in tilapia fillet?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling keeps it low; frying adds 40+ kcal from oil.

faqs.q: What about sodium in tilapia fillet?
faqs.a: Naturally low at 52mg per 100g; increases with added salt or sauces.
